Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "NEAM 2018: The 3rd Northeastern Analysis Meeting" that will be held October 19-21, 2018 at SUNY New Paltz. The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the fields of harmonic analysis and Partial Differential equations.

A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at: https://www.newpaltz.edu/neam2018/

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
NEAM 2018, the Third Northeastern Analysis Meeting, was an Analysis conference held in the Fall of 2018 at SUNY New Paltz, which drew an audience of 89 participants.

Thanks to the 16 plenary talks, all attendees were exposed to interesting concepts and methods from other fields of Mathematics, inspiring them in their own research and giving rise to cross-disciplinary collaborations.
In addition, the 43 parallel session talks gave participants the occasion to more thoroughly immerse themselves into their own fields of study.

Junior mathematicians constituted 61% of the participants and gave 68% of the conference talks. Thanks to the substantial presence of senior faculty, junior participants had an opportunity to interact with world-renowned experts in various branches of Analysis and to approach them in person, so as to benefit from their presence and from their guidance.

Many participants came from smaller regional institutions from the northeastern United States. Due to its accessibility, NEAM was the first large conference of its kind that they attended. Being scheduled in the fall, NEAM is especially helpful to participants who are currently on the job market, who can take advantage of this opportunity to polish the presentation of their results and popularize their research findings.

New Paltz undergraduate students took advantage of this unique opportunity to learn about the broad mathematical topics discussed at the conference. The poster session in particular allowed students to fully immerse themselves in a mathematical environment and to make contacts that may help them in their future careers. Some faculty members from other fields also attended.

The conference reached a wide variety of target audience groups, spanning from undergraduate, masters, and doctoral students, to postdocs, adjoint faculty, and assistant professors, to tenured faculty members, and even some retired mathematicians.

This New Paltz edition of NEAM led to sustained discussions among all participants and gave mathematicians from disparate branches of Analysis an occasion to get together and exchange ideas. The third edition of NEAM consolidated the mission of the conference to bring together all researchers interested in Mathematical Analysis, from the Northeastern US and beyond, and to serve their professional and scientific needs.

For more information about NEAM 2018, please visit our website 

https://www.newpaltz.edu/neam2018/
